import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib as mpl
import matplotlib
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.express as px
mpl.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (8,6)
mpl.rcParams['axes.grid'] = False
pd.get_option("display.max_columns")

plt.figure(figsize=(20,8))

plt.xticks(rotation=90)
plt.title('Ranking of Countries')
plt.show()

source.0037a31f:
gold,silver,bronze,country = df['Gold'],df['Silver'],df['Bronze'],df['Team/NOC']

plt.figure(figsize=(20,8))
plot1, = plt.plot(country, gold, color = 'green')
plot2, = plt.plot(country, silver, color = 'blue')
plot3, = plt.plot(country, bronze, color = 'red')
plt.title('Countries with their medlas')
plt.xlabel('Countries',size=14)
plt.ylabel('Count',size=14)
plt.xticks(rotation=90)
plt.legend([plot1,plot2,plot3],["Gold", "Silver", "Bronze"])
plt.show()
source.62e00f7c:
gold,silver,bronze,country = df['Gold'].head(5),df['Silver'].head(5),df['Bronze'].head(5),df['Team/NOC'].head(5)

plt.figure(figsize=(18,6))
plot1, = plt.plot(country, gold, color = 'green')
plot2, = plt.plot(country, silver, color = 'blue')
plot3, = plt.plot(country, bronze, color = 'red')
plt.title('Top 5 Countries with their medlas')
plt.xlabel('Countries',size=14)
plt.ylabel('Count',size=14)
plt.legend([plot1,plot2,plot3],["Gold", "Silver", "Bronze"])
plt.show()
source.48292b9b:
rank,rank_by_total,country = df['Rank'],df['Rank by Total'],df['Team/NOC']

plt.figure(figsize=(20,8))
plot1, = plt.plot(country, rank, color = 'green')
plot2, = plt.plot(country, rank_by_total, color = 'red')
plt.title('Countries with their Rank and Total medals rank')
plt.xlabel('Countries',size=14)
plt.ylabel('Rank',size=14)
plt.xticks(rotation=90)
plt.legend([plot1,plot2],["Rank", "Total Medal Rank"])
plt.show()
source.73eddfff:
final=df.drop(["Rank","Rank by Total"],axis=1).set_index("Team/NOC")
px.bar(final,x=final.index,y=["Gold","Silver","Bronze"],
       title="All countries with total medals",
       labels={"value":"Total Medals","variable":"Medal Type"},
      color_discrete_sequence=["#FFD700","#C0C0C0","#CD7F32"],
       hover_data=["Total"],
      )
source.e0d5749e:
top_ten_countries = df[df['Rank']<11]
final=top_ten_countries.drop(["Rank","Rank by Total"],axis=1).set_index("Team/NOC")
px.bar(final,x=final.index,y=["Gold","Silver","Bronze"],
       title="All countries with total medals",
       labels={"value":"Total Medals","variable":"Medal Type"},
      color_discrete_sequence=["#FFD700","#C0C0C0","#CD7F32"],
       hover_data=["Total"],width=700, height=700
      )

source.1745696a:
**From the above plot we can say that:-**
* These are the top 5 countries in the olympics.
* Again USA is on top the list with 41 silver medals followed by China with 32 silver medals but here with 28 silvers Russia is on the 3rd list followes by Britain with 21 and at last Japan with 14 silver medals in top five.
* We can say that maximum silver not play a major role in the ranking of countries in the olympics.

source.c5c66ba2:
**From the above plot we can say that:-**
* These are the top 5 countries in the olympics.
* Again USA is on top the list with 33 bronze medals followed by Russia with 23 bronze medals but here with 22 bronze Britain is on the 3rd list followes by China with 18 and at last Japan with 17 bronze medals in top five.
* We can say that maximum bronze not play a major role in the ranking of countries in the olympics.
* We can colnclude that since all 3 rankins of medals i.e. is Gold, Silver and Bronze are mostly conquered by USA thats why USA is at the 1st Rank.
source.02aee8a0: **Every country have won some medals. No country has left empty handed.**
source.b4fd0566:
**From the above graph I wanted to show that we have 2 diffrent Ranks in our dataset:-**
* First Rank shows the cuntries olympic ranking according to the Gold medals they have won
* Secondly the countries have won a sum of nice medals adding all gold, silver and bronze. So we call it as a Total Medals Rank
* There is a nice and staright slope for the Rank
* And a very zig zag slope for Total ranks, Due to addition of all the three medals
